en: He told us to come on time.
zh: 他让我们准时到。

en: We should make the best of the limited natural resources we have.
zh: 咱们得好好利用手里这点有限的自然资源。

en: We must make the best we can of the few natural resources we have.
zh: 咱们得把有限的自然资源尽可能利用好。

en: We should do our best.
zh: 咱们得尽力而为。

en: We've made a final decision.
zh: 我们已经做出了最终决定。

en: We considered going, but finally decided against it.
zh: 我们想过要去，但最后还是决定不去了。

en: We are liable to err.
zh: 人嘛，总会犯错。

en: We should so act that we shall have nothing to regret.
zh: 咱们做事得让自己以后不后悔。

en: We discussed the matter with each other.
zh: 我们互相商量了一下这件事。

en: We must try to preserve the remains of ancient civilizations.
zh: 我们得设法保护古代文明的遗迹。

en: We have established the institute with a view to facilitating the research.
zh: 我们成立这个研究所是为了方便做研究。

en: We must make the best of what we are.
zh: 咱们得在现有的基础上做到最好。

en: We were obliged to give up our plan.
zh: 我们不得不放弃了计划。

en: While we hate force, we recognize the need for law and order.
zh: 虽然我们讨厌武力，但我们也明白法律和秩序的必要性。

en: We must try to break the deadlock.
zh: 我们必须试着打破僵局。

en: We were crowded into the small room.
zh: 我们全被挤在那个小房间里。

en: We discussed the matter from an educational point of view.
zh: 我们从教育的角度讨论了这件事。

en: It should be stressed that we are often influenced by advertising without being aware of it.
zh: 必须强调的是，我们经常在不知不觉中受到广告的影响。

en: We were all drenched with perspiration.
zh: 我们全都汗流浃背的。

en: We were all shaking from the bitter cold.
zh: 我们都被冻得直打哆嗦。

en: We all shuddered from the great shock.
zh: 我们都被吓了一大跳。

en: We are all looking forward to seeing you and your family.
zh: 我们都很期待见到你和你家人。

en: We wanted to speak to the president of the company, but he refused to speak to us.
zh: 我们想找老板谈谈，但他拒绝见我们。

en: We participated in the athletic meet of our company.
zh: 我们参加了公司的运动会。

en: We look back on days gone by, if not always with affections, at any rate with a kind of wistfulness.
zh: 回首往事，就算不总是满怀深情，起码也会有些惆怅。

en: No one of us can cut himself off from the body of the community to which he belongs.
zh: 谁也没法脱离自己所属的那个群体。

en: We are studying in order to pass the STEP 2nd grade test.
zh: 我们在为了通过二级考试而学习。

en: We die only once, and for such a long time.
zh: 人只死一次，而且一死就是好久。

en: We were as one in our opinion.
zh: 我们的意见完全一致。

en: We were all ears.
zh: 我们都在洗耳恭听。

en: We climbed higher so that we might get a better view.
zh: 我们往高处爬了爬，想看得更清楚点。

en: We didn't mean to leave Mary out of the plan.
zh: 我们不是故意要把玛丽撇在计划之外的。

en: All of us are connected with the past and the future as well as the present.
zh: 我们所有人都与过去、现在和未来紧密相连。

en: We were all surprised at the effect the news had on him.
zh: 那个消息对他影响这么大，我们都很吃惊。

en: We were all very happy at breakfast.
zh: 吃早饭的时候大家都特别开心。

en: We have yet to learn the truth.
zh: 我们还没搞清楚真相。

en: We have yet to learn all the facts.
zh: 我们还没掌握全部的事实。

en: We should sometimes pause to think.
zh: 我们有时应该停下来思考一下。

en: We should read as many books as possible.
zh: 我们应该尽可能多读书。

en: We stood at the door and waited.
zh: 我们站在门口等着。

en: We must put an end to a bad habit as soon as possible.
zh: 我们得尽快改掉坏习惯。

en: It is not for us to live in such a fine house.
zh: 咱们哪住得起这么好的房子。

en: We must guard against mistakes in spelling.
zh: 咱们得留心别写错别字。

en: We considered the problem from all angles.
zh: 我们从各个角度考虑了那个问题。

en: We love the man all the better for his faults.
zh: 正因为他有那些缺点，我们反而更喜欢他。

en: We must make up for the loss.
zh: 我们必须弥补损失。

en: We measured the depth of the river.
zh: 我们测了测河水的深度。

en: We must study the affair as a whole.
zh: 我们得整体地研究这件事。

en: We could get over the difficulty.
zh: 我们能克服这个困难。

en: We've set the meeting tentatively for Monday. It's subject to change.
zh: 会议暂定在周一，以后可能还会变。

en: We looked forward to the party.
zh: 我们一直挺期待那个派对的。

en: We must go without luxuries.
zh: 我们得过没奢侈品的苦日子了。

en: At best we can only hope for a small profit.
zh: 充其量咱们也就只能赚点小钱。

en: We elected Jane chairperson.
zh: 我们选了简当主席。

en: We must consider these matters as a whole.
zh: 我们得把这些事儿作为一个整体来考虑。

en: We are very much concerned about the future of this country.
zh: 我们非常担心这个国家的未来。

en: We were certain of winning the game.
zh: 我们当时觉得肯定能赢。

en: We narrowly missed the accident.
zh: 我们差点儿出意外。

en: We found out a secret door behind the curtain.
zh: 我们在窗帘后面发现了一扇暗门。

en: It should not be possible for us to enjoy them without giving something in return.
zh: 咱们不该不劳而获。

en: We differ from them in some respects.
zh: 我们在有些方面跟他们不太一样。

en: We shall overcome all our difficulties.
zh: 我们肯定能克服所有的困难。

en: We were wont to meet at that pleasant spot.
zh: 我们以前经常在那个舒服的地方碰头。

en: We look on her as a loose woman.
zh: 我们觉得她这人私生活挺乱的。

en: We couldn't find out her whereabouts.
zh: 我们打听不到她的下落。

en: We were surprised at the ease with which he solved the problem.
zh: 真没想到他居然能这么轻松地解决这个问题。

en: We cannot dispense with the rainforests.
zh: 咱们可离不开热带雨林。

en: We lay emphasis on the importance of being sincere.
zh: 我们非常看重待人真诚。

en: We are indirectly dependent upon the labour of others for all the necessities and comforts of our lives.
zh: 我们生活中的必需品和享受，间接来说都是靠别人的劳动换来的。

en: We credit Peary with having discovered the North Pole.
zh: 我们公认是皮里发现了北极。

en: We must defend our freedom at all cost.
zh: 我们必须不惜一切代价捍卫自由。

en: We sat, as it were, on a volcano.
zh: 我们当时简直就像坐在火山口上一样。

en: We find ourselves in the twilight of our civilization.
zh: 我们感觉咱们的文明已经步入暮年了。

en: Our plane was flying over the Pacific Ocean.
zh: 我们的飞机当时正飞在太平洋上空。

en: Our plane was flying above the clouds.
zh: 我们的飞机当时在云层上面飞。

en: Our feelings towards him are mixed.
zh: 我们对他这人的感情挺复杂的。

en: Not a day passes in which we don't use electricity in our daily lives.
zh: 咱们过日子哪天离得开电啊。

en: You stood out in our circle.
zh: 你在我们这圈人里挺出众的。

en: The records of our discussions are kept by the secretary.
zh: 讨论记录都在秘书那儿存着呢。

en: Language as we know is a human invention.
zh: 咱们都知道，语言是人类发明的。

en: Our escape was nothing short of a miracle.
zh: 我们能逃出来简直就是个奇迹。

en: Our teacher is a gentleman in the true sense of the word.
zh: 我们老师是个名副其实的绅士。

en: Our policies and systems are getting outdated and need revising, but to try to swap horses while crossing a stream might be dangerous.
zh: 咱们的政策和制度有点过时了，得改改，但临阵换将恐怕会有风险。

en: Our generation has seen a lot of changes.
zh: 我们这一代人见证了不少变化。

en: Our world is only a small part of the universe.
zh: 我们的世界只是宇宙中很小的一部分。

en: The obstacles to our progress have been removed at last.
zh: 阻碍我们进步的那些绊脚石总算都被挪走了。

en: Our letters probably crossed in the mail.
zh: 咱们寄的信可能在路上错过了。

en: In our society we find men of integrity along with crooks.
zh: 在我们的社会里，既有正直的人，也有骗子。

en: We've received a lot of applications in answer to our advertisements.
zh: 我们打广告后收到了很多申请。

en: Our tastes in art agree.
zh: 我们在艺术方面的品味挺一致的。

en: Don't mention our plan to anybody.
zh: 别跟任何人提起咱们的计划。

en: Our plan will call for a lot of money.
zh: 咱们这个计划得花不少钱。

en: Our project didn't get off the ground until he joined the company.
zh: 直到他进公司，咱们的项目才算真正开始运作。

en: Most of our money goes for food.
zh: 我们的大部分钱都花在吃上了。

en: Our plans for the vacation are still up in the air.
zh: 我们度假的计划还没定下来呢。

en: Our patience is in much the same condition as yesterday.
zh: 我们的耐心程度跟昨天差不多。

en: Our company pays badly.
zh: 我们公司工资给得挺低的。

en: It will be three months before our house is completed.
zh: 咱们的房子还得三个月才能盖好。

en: Although our universe is still young, theorists are busy exploring its ultimate fate.
zh: 虽然宇宙还很年轻，但理论家们已经忙着研究它的终极归宿了。

en: Not all of us are born with musical talent.
zh: 不是所有人天生就有音乐细胞的。

en: There is nothing in the world but teaches us some good lesson.
zh: 世上没什么事是不能让我们学到点道理的。

en: We had scarcely returned when it began raining.
zh: 我们刚一回来，天就下起雨来了。

en: We cannot know too much about the language we speak every day of our lives.
zh: 对于我们每天都在说的语言，再怎么钻研都不为过。

en: Language, as we know it, is a human invention.
zh: 我们所熟知的语言其实是人类发明出来的。

en: To our great relief, she returned home safe and sound.
zh: 让我们大松一口气的是，她平安无事地回家了。

en: If we suspect others, others will suspect us just as much.
zh: 如果我们怀疑别人，别人也一样会怀疑我们。

en: No one knows the real reason why we love dogs.
zh: 没人知道我们为什么这么爱狗。

en: It should not be possible for us to enjoy them.
zh: 我们本不应该能从中得到乐趣。

en: Three hours is too short for us to discuss that matter.
zh: 三个小时太短了，不够我们讨论那件事。

en: It was just an accident that we met at the store.
zh: 我们在店里碰见纯属巧合。

en: A problem of whose importance we are fully aware.
zh: 这是一个我们完全意识到其重要性的问题。

en: No one ever knew the true story except the three of us.
zh: 除了我们三个，没人知道事情的真相。

en: Give me liberty or give me death.
zh: 不自由，毋宁死。

en: He shivered a little in spite of himself.
zh: 他忍不住打了个冷颤。

en: I am ashamed of myself.
zh: 我真为自己感到羞愧。

en: Broken glass lay scattered all over the road.
zh: 马路上到处都是碎玻璃。

en: I've caught a bad cold.
zh: 我得了重感冒。

en: Stop yelling, I beg you.
zh: 别嚷嚷了，算我求你了。

en: A man of straw is worth a woman of gold.
zh: 再没用的男人也比优秀的女人强。

en: The crocodile, which produces only male young in hotter weather, might die out too because there will be no females to breed.
zh: 鳄鱼在天热时只生雄性，可能会因为没有雌性繁殖而灭绝。

en: It seems that Wataru devoted himself to his studies.
zh: 看来航一直在埋头苦读。

en: I know better than to lend him money.
zh: 我才没那么傻，不会借钱给他的。

en: From the fullness of his grace we have all received one blessing after another.
zh: 靠着他丰盛的恩典，我们都领受了一个又一个的福气。

en: We all learned the poem by heart.
zh: 我们把那首诗都背下来了。

en: I have to get some new clothes.
zh: 我得买几件新衣服了。

en: I'm working in Tokyo now.
zh: 我现在在东京工作。

en: Please take me across the river.
zh: 请带我过河。

en: Please take me over to the other side.
zh: 请带我到对岸去。

en: I'm going to Europe next week.
zh: 我下周要去欧洲。

en: I'll be sixteen years old next month.
zh: 下个月我就十六岁了。

en: I study about two hours every day.
zh: 我每天大约学两个小时。

en: I must finish my homework before dinner.
zh: 我得在晚饭前把作业写完。

en: I put away 10 dollars each month.
zh: 我每个月存10块钱。

en: I walked up the hill.
zh: 我走上了山坡。

en: I should like to have a friend to correspond with.
zh: 我想找个可以通信的朋友。

en: I usually go to bed at ten.
zh: 我通常十点睡觉。

en: I prefer traveling by train to flying.
zh: 比起坐飞机，我更喜欢坐火车旅行。

en: I'm tired now.
zh: 我现在累了。

en: I tried to warn her, but she wouldn't listen.
zh: 我试过提醒她，但她就是不听。

en: I'm looking forward to hearing from her.
zh: 我期待着收到她的来信。

en: I have a firm belief in his innocence.
zh: 我坚信他是清白的。

en: I regret not having taken his advice.
zh: 我后悔没听他的建议。

en: I do not love him the less for his faults.
zh: 我并没有因为他的缺点而少爱他一点。

en: I didn't want his help, but I had to accept it.
zh: 我本不想要他的帮助，但不得不接受。

en: I could not convince him of his mistake.
zh: 我没法让他意识到自己错了。

en: I couldn't get in touch with him.
zh: 我没联系上他。

en: I saw him run away.
zh: 我看见他跑了。

en: I have not yet learned whether he reached there or not.
zh: 我还不清楚他到底到了没有。

en: I like both dogs and cats.
zh: 猫和狗我都喜欢。

en: I know an American girl who speaks Japanese very well.
zh: 我认识一个日语说得特别好的美国女孩。

en: I am pleased with myself.
zh: 我对自己挺满意的。

en: I don't think I'm cut out for city life.
zh: 我觉得我不适合城里的生活。

en: I did some work after breakfast and went out.
zh: 吃完早饭我干了点活儿，然后就出门了。

en: I intend to take my position as a third party.
zh: 我打算站在第三方的立场上。

en: I am looking for a house to rent.
zh: 我正在找房子租。

en: I can't walk because of my broken leg.
zh: 我腿断了，走不了路。

en: I have little knowledge of biochemistry.
zh: 我对生物化学不太了解。

en: I am completely against it.
zh: 我完全反对。

en: I feel for you deeply.
zh: 我特别能体谅你。

en: I swim once a week.
zh: 我每周游一次泳。

en: I got my hands quite dirty.
zh: 我把手弄得挺脏的。

en: I wrote off for an application form.
zh: 我写信去索取申请表了。

en: I like to perform magic tricks for kids, but they sometimes fall flat.
zh: 我喜欢给孩子变魔术，但有时没人买账。

en: I couldn't recognize him at first.
zh: 我起初没认出他来。

en: I intended to visit Rome last year.
zh: 我去年本打算去罗马的。

en: I am a lapsed vegetarian.
zh: 我以前吃素，现在不吃了。

en: I want a wife and children, and so I need a house.
zh: 我想要老婆孩子，所以得有个房子。

en: I had enough to do to catch the last bus.
zh: 我费了好大劲才赶上末班车。

en: I'll never be able to play again.
zh: 我再也没法上场了。

en: I may have nothing now, but I shall always have something to remember, while you have no memories at all.
zh: 我现在可能一无所有，但我总还有回忆，而你却什么记忆都没有。

en: I have nothing to boast about.
zh: 我没什么好吹嘘的。

en: I have a cat and a dog.
zh: 我养了一只猫和一只狗。

en: I want to go with you.
zh: 我想跟你一起去。

en: We've finished cleaning our classroom.
zh: 教室我们已经打扫完了。

en: I'm from Kyoto.
zh: 我来自京都。

en: I was a first year student last year.
zh: 我去年是大一新生。

en: We decided to put off the meeting until next Sunday.
zh: 我们决定把会议推迟到下周日。

en: I was weary of doing the same thing over and over again.
zh: 我厌倦了翻来覆去地做同样的事情。

en: I like music, and I listen to it every day.
zh: 我喜欢音乐，每天都听。

en: I must make up for lost time by driving fast.
zh: 我得开快点，把耽误的时间补回来。

en: I have a respect for those who went before me.
zh: 我很敬佩我的前辈。

en: I was forced to accept her proposal.
zh: 我被迫接受了她的建议。

en: I simply don't understand this.
zh: 我简直弄不明白这个。

en: I would be very pleased to go with you.
zh: 我很乐意陪你一起去。

en: I have almost no money with me.
zh: 我身上几乎没带钱。

en: I am good friends with Beth.
zh: 我和贝丝是好朋友。

en: I was able to play piano very well.
zh: 我以前钢琴弹得特别好。

en: I like pizza very much.
zh: 我特别喜欢吃披萨。

en: I cannot go to the party, but thank you for inviting me all the same.
zh: 我参加不了聚会，但还是要谢谢你的邀请。

en: I am determined to make a living as a playwright at all costs.
zh: 无论如何，我都下定决心要靠写剧本谋生。

en: I would not leave you for all the world.
zh: 无论如何我都不会离开你。

en: I managed to get there in time.
zh: 我总算准时赶到了那里。

en: As far as I'm concerned, I will not approve of the plan.
zh: 对我来说，我不会赞成这个计划。

en: I was appalled at the sight.
zh: 那个场景把我给惊呆了。

en: I'm learning how to type.
zh: 我正在学打字。

en: I doubt whether it is true or not.
zh: 我怀疑这到底是不是真的。

en: I have nothing to say against it.
zh: 我对此没什么异议。

en: I didn't consider the subject seriously.
zh: 我没认真考虑过这个问题。

en: I have nothing to do with the affair.
zh: 那件事跟我没关系。

en: I have hopes of doing well in that business.
zh: 我希望能把那门生意做好。

en: I built a new house in view of the mountain.
zh: 我在能看到山的地方盖了栋新房。

en: The tune was not familiar to me.
zh: 这个曲子我不熟。

en: I was given training in that school.
zh: 我在那个学校接受过培训。

en: I didn't take part in the conversation.
zh: 我没参与那场谈话。

en: I'm looking at the flower.
zh: 我在看花。

en: I really enjoyed myself at the party.
zh: 派对上我玩得很开心。

en: I was absent from the party.
zh: 我没去参加派对。

en: I am quite unhappy about it.
zh: 我对这事儿挺不高兴的。

en: I wanted to go there.
zh: 我当时想去那儿。

en: I didn't mean to do that.
zh: 我不是故意的。

en: I will write Judy a letter.
zh: 我会给朱迪写封信。

en: I'm staying at the Sheraton Hotel.
zh: 我住在喜来登酒店。

en: I went into details.
zh: 我详细说明了一下。

en: I've read any and every book in this library.
zh: 这个图书馆里的每本书我都读过了。

en: I must pull myself together to overcome this incident.
zh: 我必须振作起来，渡过这个难关。

en: Each time I see this picture, I remember my father.
zh: 每次看到这张照片，我都会想起我父亲。

en: I paid 40,000 yen for this tape recorder.
zh: 这个录音机我花了四万日元。

en: I prefer coffee to tea.
zh: 比起茶，我更喜欢咖啡。

en: I am not the Christ but I am sent ahead of him.
zh: 我不是基督，但我是在他之前被差遣的。

en: When I see you, you always remind me of my brother.
zh: 每次见到你，我都会想起我兄弟。

en: I invited them to the party.
zh: 我邀请他们来参加派对了。

en: His name has completely gone out of my mind.
zh: 他的名字我忘得干干净净。

en: I don't like his shallow personality.
zh: 我不喜欢他那浅薄的性格。

en: What he said really hurt me.
zh: 他说的话真的很伤人。

en: I couldn't help but turn down his offer.
zh: 我只好拒绝了他的提议。

en: I am a student at Oxford University.
zh: 我是牛津大学的学生。

en: He got very angry, for she refused to follow his advice.
zh: 他很生气，因为她不听他的建议。

en: I succeeded in worming out the secret.
zh: 我成功套出了那个秘密。

en: I always walk to school.
zh: 我总是走路去学校。

en: I went to bed later than usual.
zh: 我睡得比平时晚。

en: I wasn't always happy.
zh: 我也不是一直都开心。

en: I am always helped by you.
zh: 总是你在帮我。

en: I have a desire to go to England.
zh: 我很想去英国。

en: I captured butterflies with a net.
zh: 我用网兜抓了蝴蝶。

en: I haven't a very good dictionary.
zh: 我没什么好字典。

en: I can beat you to the station.
zh: 我能比你先到车站。

en: I can understand your language.
zh: 我能听懂你说的话。

en: I am much concerned about your health.
zh: 我很担心你的身体。

en: I want to travel with you.
zh: 我想和你一起去旅行。

en: I took it that you would come.
zh: 我还以为你会来呢。

en: That's the part I liked best.
zh: 那是我最喜欢的部分。

en: I'd like to reserve a table for three.
zh: 我想订个三个人的位子。

en: I saw a movie for the first time in two years.
zh: 我两年来头一回看电影。

en: I exempted her from working overtime.
zh: 我没让她加班。

en: I am a bachelor.
zh: 我还是单身。

en: I am at home.
zh: 我在家。

en: I met Mary and John when in London.
zh: 我在伦敦的时候见到了玛丽和约翰。

en: I lost the camera I had bought the day before.
zh: 我把前一天买的相机丢了。

en: I availed myself of this favorable opportunity.
zh: 我抓住了这个好机会。

en: I believe in Ken.
zh: 我相信肯。

en: I don't want to identify myself with that group.
zh: 我不想和那一群人扯上关系。

en: I am more beautiful than you.
zh: 我比你漂亮。

en: It seems to me that you are wrong.
zh: 我觉得你错了。

en: And I will raise it again in three days.
zh: 三天后我还会再提这件事。

en: He has said so himself to my knowledge.
zh: 据我所知，他自己就是这么说的。

en: You are welcome to any book in my library.
zh: 我书架上的书你随便看。

en: My uncle has a store along the street.
zh: 我叔叔在街边开了家店。

en: My watch keeps very good time.
zh: 我的表走得很准。

en: All hope of my promotion went up in smoke after my reorganization plan fell through.
zh: 重组计划泡汤后，我的升职希望全完了。

en: Do you think that my way of teaching is wrong?
zh: 你觉得我教书的方法有问题吗？

en: Please don't take my mind off the work.
zh: 请别让我分心。

en: The men I meet are all very nice.
zh: 我遇到的人都挺好的。

en: My house stands on a hill.
zh: 我家在山上。

en: My house is only a mile from here.
zh: 我家离这儿也就一英里。

en: Pass me the wine, please.
zh: 把酒递给我。

en: My aunt lives in New York.
zh: 我阿姨住在纽约。

en: I have a friend whose father is a famous pianist.
zh: 我有个朋友，他爸爸是位著名的钢琴家。

en: Work is all in all to me.
zh: 工作就是我的全部。

en: I have no time to watch TV.
zh: 我没时间看电视。

en: I have no particular reason to do so.
zh: 我没啥特别的理由非得这么做。

en: I have a lot of work to do.
zh: 我有很多活儿要干。

en: Let us students contribute to the welfare of the victims of the earthquake; even loose change will go a long way.
zh: 咱们学生也给地震灾民捐点款吧，哪怕是零钱也能帮上大忙。

en: We walked among the trees.
zh: 我们在林子里走着。

en: We should love our neighbors.
zh: 我们应该爱护邻里。

en: We will have a math class tomorrow.
zh: 我们明天有数学课。

en: We can normally conceal our thoughts from others.
zh: 通常我们都能把心思藏得挺好，不让别人看出来。

en: We crossed several rivers on the way.
zh: 我们路上过了好几条河。

en: We have seen three wars.
zh: 我们见证过三次战争。

en: When we go to bed, we say "good night".
zh: 我们睡觉前会说“晚安”。

en: We covered some 100 miles in the car.
zh: 我们开车跑了大约100英里。

en: We are in the tie-up.
zh: 我们被堵在路上了。

en: We discussed the plan yesterday.
zh: 我们昨天讨论了那个计划。

en: We shouted in order to warn everyone of the danger.
zh: 我们大喊是为了提醒大家注意危险。

en: We all took it for granted that the professor could speak English.
zh: 我们都理所当然地以为教授会说英语。

en: We have known each other for many years now.
zh: 我们认识好多年了。

en: We all try hard to make the grade in life, but only a few succeed.
zh: 我们都想在生活中出人头地，但成功的只有少数。

en: We all make fools of ourselves at times.
zh: 我们有时候都会出洋相。

en: We got the tree up.
zh: 我们把树立起来了。

en: We managed to get it back without her knowing about it.
zh: 我们瞒着她把东西拿回来了。

en: We noticed the man enter her room.
zh: 我们看到那个男的进她房间了。

en: We took a taxi so as to reach there on time.
zh: 我们打了个车，好准时赶到那里。

en: We elected Jeffrey captain of our team.
zh: 我们选了杰弗里当我们的队长。

en: After we had walked for some time, we came to the lake.
zh: 走了一会儿，我们就到了湖边。

en: We were impatient for the concert to begin.
zh: 我们等不及音乐会开始了。

en: We drove to Hakone last Sunday.
zh: 上个星期天我们开车去了箱根。

en: We speak that we do know, and testify that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.
zh: 我们说的是我们知道的，证的是我们见过的，但你们就是不信。

en: We all knew that Bob was on a wild-goose chase after Marge, because she was already happily engaged.
zh: 我们都知道鲍勃在瞎忙活追玛吉，因为人家都已经订婚了，幸福着呢。

en: We've been horsing around too much; it's high time we got down to brass tacks.
zh: 咱们瞎闹得够久了，该谈点正事了。

en: We are anxious for your help.
zh: 我们急需你的帮助。

en: Our school is across the river.
zh: 我们学校在河对岸。

en: Our efforts will soon bear fruit.
zh: 我们的努力很快就会有成果了。

en: Our firm is a giant one, and there are some rules and regulations, which should be revised or rescinded to reduce red tape and increase efficiency.
zh: 我们公司很大，有些规章制度得改改或者废除，好减少官僚作风，提高效率。

en: It isn't necessary to make a decision now about where we'll meet.
zh: 现在没必要决定在哪儿见面。

en: We were delayed by traffic congestion, so we had to hurry.
zh: 刚才堵车了，所以我们得赶快。

en: I cannot agree with you on this point.
zh: 这点我没法同意。

en: I'll get some glasses.
zh: 我去拿几个杯子。

en: The party was well along when I came.
zh: 我来的时候聚会都已经进行到一半了。

en: I was taking a bath when the telephone rang.
zh: 电话响的时候我正在洗澡。

en: Whenever I needed money as a college student, my parents always came through.
zh: 上大学那会儿，只要我缺钱，我爸妈总会给我寄。

en: It is just a year since I got married.
zh: 我结婚刚好满一年。

en: When I came home, he was watching TV.
zh: 我回到家的时候，他正在看电视。

en: You can't wring any more money from me.
zh: 你没法从我这儿再抠出钱来了。

en: It was during my college years that I took up tennis.
zh: 我是上大学那会儿开始打网球的。

en: I got control of the works.
zh: 我接管了工厂。

en: It is the car that we have wanted.
zh: 这就是我们一直想要的那辆车。

en: When I see this picture, I always think of the old days.
zh: 看到这张照片，我就总会想起过去。

en: Now that I am here, you don't have to worry.
zh: 既然我来了，你就不用担心了。

en: Don't enter the room until I say "All right."
zh: 我说“可以了”之前，别进房间。

en: We rented that house, not because we were pleased with it, but because it was near the station.
zh: 我们租那房子不是因为喜欢，而是因为它离车站近。

en: A few words may betray a man's true character.
zh: 言谈之间就能看出一个人的本性。

en: It's hard for him to live on his small pension.
zh: 靠那点微薄的养老金，他很难维持生活。

en: You can use the delivery service for a small additional charge.
zh: 付一点点额外的费用就可以享受送货服务。

en: It's hard for me to live on my small income.
zh: 靠我这点收入，日子过得挺不容易的。

en: The slightest mistake may lead to a fatal disaster.
zh: 稍微出点差错就可能导致致命的灾难。

en: Don't haggle over a small sum of money.
zh: 别为了这点小钱斤斤计较。

en: What little guidance I had I owe to a young man.
zh: 我得到的那点指点全多亏了一个年轻人。

en: What little money he earned he spent on books.
zh: 他挣的那点钱全花在买书上了。

en: She has a little money put aside.
zh: 她存了一点钱。

en: It would be unwise, not to say stupid, of you to quit your first job after only six months.
zh: 第一份工作才干半年就辞职，这不明智，甚至有点傻。

en: Only 40 percent of students go on to university.
zh: 只有40%的学生会上大学。

en: After only 36 months, Koko could use 184 signs.
zh: 才过了36个月，Koko就能使用184个手势了。

en: Which is the capital of the United States, Washington or New York?
zh: 美国的首都是哪儿？华盛顿还是纽约？

en: Cherry trees are now in bloom in Washington.
zh: 华盛顿的樱花现在开了。

en: The eagle is king of birds.
zh: 老鹰是鸟类之王。

en: The eagle dived at its prey.
zh: 老鹰向它的猎物俯冲过去。

en: An eagle is flying in the sky.
zh: 天上有一只老鹰在飞。

en: Don't bother to call on him.
zh: 不用麻烦去拜访他了。

en: Please don't go to the trouble of coming to our office.
zh: 您不用麻烦特地跑一趟我们办公室。

en: Don't bother to call me.
zh: 不用麻烦给我打电话。

en: I may be playing the devil's advocate, but I have to ask, what are we going to do if we don't get all the customers we expect?
zh: 也许我是在唱反调，但我还是得问一下，要是客户没预期那么多，我们该怎么办？

en: It is kind of you go out of your way to help me.
zh: 你能特意来帮我，真是太感谢了。

en: You don't have to go to the trouble of getting an umbrella.
zh: 你不用费事去拿伞。

en: Thank you very much for coming all the way to see me off.
zh: 太感谢你大老远赶来送我了。

en: Don't take the trouble to come and meet me.
zh: 别特意来接我了。

en: Thank you for coming all the way to see me.
zh: 谢谢你大老远过来看我。

en: Thank you very much for driving me all the way to my house.
zh: 非常感谢你特意开车把我送回家。

en: Do not bother to come to my home.
zh: 不用麻烦来我家了。

en: Don't bother to pick me up at the hotel.
zh: 不用麻烦去酒店接我。

en: How good of you to come all the way to see me off!
zh: 你能大老远来送我，真是太有心了！

en: Thank you for coming all the way to see me off.
zh: 谢谢你特意跑一趟来送我。

en: Don't bother to come to my house.
zh: 别费事来我家了。

en: Don't ask me why.
zh: 别问我为什么。

en: I've got a pain in my side.
zh: 我腰侧疼。

en: Our combined fleet broke through the enemy's defense zone.
zh: 我们的联合舰队突破了敌人的防区。

en: Our fighters averaged 430 missions a day.
zh: 我们的战斗机平均每天执行 430 次任务。

en: Abide with me.
zh: 与我同在。

en: Our company has come a long way since it was set up.
zh: 我们公司自成立以来走过了很长一段路。

en: Our company is planning to build a new chemical plant in Russia.
zh: 我们公司打算在俄罗斯建个新的化工厂。

en: Our company wants to take part in that research project.
zh: 我们公司想参加那个科研项目。

en: We made a contract with the firm.
zh: 我们和那家公司签了合同。

en: Our personnel are very highly educated.
zh: 我们的员工学历都很高。

en: We have cut back production by 20%.
zh: 我们减产了 20%。

en: There is no mother who doesn't love her own child.
zh: 没有哪个母亲是不爱自己孩子的。

en: We do business with the United States.
zh: 我们和美国有生意往来。

en: We depend on foreign nations for our natural resources.
zh: 我们的自然资源依赖国外。

en: Our country abounds in products.
zh: 我们国家物产丰富。

en: Our country is in a crisis.
zh: 我们国家正处于危机之中。

en: Our country is rich in marine products.
zh: 我们国家的海产品非常丰富。

en: Our country has enjoyed many years of unbroken peace.
zh: 我们国家多年来一直太平无事。

en: Our country is running short of energy resources.
zh: 我们国家的能源正面临短缺。

en: We import tea from India.
zh: 我们从印度进口茶叶。

en: Our cities create serious pollution problems.
zh: 我们的城市面临严重的污染问题。

en: Crime is certainly on the increase in many of our big cities.
zh: 在我们的许多大城市里，犯罪率确实在上升。

en: Our tax system is still without coherent philosophy.
zh: 我们的税收制度仍然缺乏统一的理念。

en: The morals of our politicians have been corrupted.
zh: 我们的政客道德败坏。

en: The chief crop of our country is rice.
zh: 我们国家的主要农作物是水稻。

en: The gross national product of our country is the second largest.
zh: 我们国家的国民生产总值居世界第二。

en: Our people thirst for independence.
zh: 我们的人民渴望独立。

en: I was extremely disappointed to see our national soccer team suffer a historic loss.
zh: 看到国足遭遇历史性的惨败，我失望透了。

en: Computer science has made rapid progress in our country.
zh: 计算机科学在我们国家发展迅速。

en: We will play Minami High School tomorrow.
zh: 我们明天要跟南高中打比赛。

en: Our school was founded in 1990.
zh: 我们学校建于 1990 年。

en: Our army attacked the enemy during the night.
zh: 我们的军队在夜间袭击了敌人。

en: We gave the enemy a drubbing.
zh: 我们把敌人狠狠揍了一顿。

en: Our troops engaged with the enemy.
zh: 我们的部队和敌人交火了。

en: There is a church near my house.
zh: 我家附近有个教堂。

en: I am beginning to understand.
zh: 我有点明白了。

en: I don't know. It all happened in an instant.
zh: 我不知道，这一切都发生在一瞬间。

en: Begin with such books as you can easily understand.
zh: 先从那些你能看懂的书看起。

en: Certainly. What can I do?
zh: 当然可以，我能帮什么忙吗？

en: If you don't know, you had better ask around.
zh: 如果你不知道，最好去打听打听。

en: "I don't know", said Tony.
zh: “我不知道，”托尼说。

en: Don't hesitate to ask questions if you don't understand.
zh: 如果不明白，尽管问。

en: Don't be unreasonable.
zh: 别不讲理。

en: I don't know. Is there a nickname for Tokyo?
zh: 我不知道。东京有绰号吗？

en: There is no satisfying spoiled children.
zh: 被宠坏的孩子是怎么也满足不了的。

en: Yes, I'll be right there.
zh: 好的，我马上就到。

en: Raise your hand if you understand it.
zh: 听懂了的请举手。

en: OK. I'll send it out as soon as a machine is available.
zh: 行，有空出的机器我就发出去。

en: Ok, let's give it a try.
zh: 行，咱们试试看吧。

en: All right, do it your own way, but don't blame me if you fail.
zh: 行吧，按你自己的想法做，但搞砸了别怪我。

en: Our team won in the intercollegiate tournament.
zh: 我们队在校际比赛里赢了。

en: Our team scored five runs in the last inning.
zh: 我们队在最后一局拿了五分。

en: Our team is in the cellar.
zh: 我们队现在垫底。

en: Our team played an even game with team "S".
zh: 我们队和S队打平了。

en: Our team lost.
zh: 我们队输了。

en: Our soccer team was covered in glory.
zh: 我们的足球队赢得了巨大的荣誉。

en: Our army attacked the kingdom.
zh: 我们的军队进攻了那个王国。

en: Is there enough money to get a bottle of wine?
zh: 钱够买瓶酒吗？

en: I'd like to have a glass of wine.
zh: 我想来杯红酒。

en: I want to chill the wine more.
zh: 我想让这酒再冰一会儿。

en: We'd like another bottle of wine.
zh: 我们想再要一瓶酒。

en: We'd like to have some wine.
zh: 我们想喝点酒。

en: May I see the wine list?
zh: 我可以看一下酒单吗？

en: Wine is not harmful in itself.
zh: 酒本身并没有什么害处。

en: Wine is made from grapes.
zh: 葡萄酒是葡萄酿的。

en: Wine helps digest food.
zh: 葡萄酒有助于消化。

en: There is little wine left.
zh: 酒不剩多少了。

en: Wine is put in casks to age.
zh: 葡萄酒被装进木桶里陈化。

en: He was groggy from too much wine.
zh: 他酒喝多了，晕乎乎的。

en: Heavy taxes are laid on wine.
zh: 葡萄酒的税很重。

en: Wine can make the meal.
zh: 有了酒这顿饭才算完美。

en: I hope the wine is to your taste.
zh: 希望这酒合你口味。

en: Mr Wilder gave me your e-mail address.
zh: 怀尔德先生把你的邮箱地址给我了。

en: Would you sew a button on my shirt?
zh: 能帮我的衬衫缝个扣子吗？

en: What number bus do I take to get to Waikiki?
zh: 去威基基要坐几路车？

en: Crying loudly, the little girl hurried to the door.
zh: 那个小女孩大声哭着，跑向门口。

en: The Japanese World Cup champion team came back home flushed with victory.
zh: 夺得世界杯冠军的日本队凯旋而归。

en: I want to buy a word processor.
zh: 我想买台文字处理机。

en: The word processor will save you a lot of trouble.
zh: 有了文字处理机会省掉你不少麻烦。

en: Should the word processor go wrong, we guarantee to replace it free of charge.
zh: 如果文字处理机出了问题，我们保证免费更换。

en: The development of word-processors has enabled us to type Japanese easily.
zh: 文字处理机的发展让我们能更轻松地打日语。

en: Typewriters are giving way to word-processors.
zh: 打字机正在被文字处理机取代。

en: If you had a word processor, you'd be free from all this trouble.
zh: 如果你有台文字处理机，就没这么多麻烦事了。

en: Do you know how to use a word processor?
zh: 你知道怎么用文字处理机吗？

en: That would be lovely.
zh: 那太好了。

en: It's a beautiful day!
zh: 天气真好！

en: Did you visit the Tower of London?
zh: 你去伦敦塔了吗？

en: While in London, she studied English.
zh: 她在伦敦的时候学了英语。

en: He brushed up his English during his stay in London.
zh: 他在伦敦期间温习了一下英语。

en: He went to see her while she stayed in London.
zh: 她在伦敦时，他去看过她。

en: The river that flows through London is the Thames.
zh: 流经伦敦的那条河是泰晤士河。

en: Two and three halves to London, please.
zh: 请给我两张成人票和三张半价票去伦敦。

en: Look up the trains to London in the timetable.
zh: 在时刻表上查一下去伦敦的火车。

en: Which is the platform for the London train?
zh: 去伦敦的火车在哪个站台？

en: I got on the train for London.
zh: 我上了去伦敦的火车。

en: The river which flows through London is called the Thames.
zh: 流经伦敦的那条河叫泰晤士河。

en: Have you been to London before?
zh: 你以前去过伦敦吗？

en: On the way to London Mr Higgins told Tom and Susie many interesting things.
zh: 在去伦敦的路上，希金斯先生给汤姆和苏西讲了许多趣事。

en: She hasn't phoned since she went to London.
zh: 她去伦敦以后就没打过电话。

en: London is famous for its fog.
zh: 伦敦的大雾很有名。

en: London was a city built for the horse.
zh: 伦敦是一座以前专门为马车设计的城市。

en: London developed into the general market of Europe.
zh: 伦敦后来变成了全欧洲的市场中心。

en: London is among the largest cities in the world.
zh: 伦敦是世界上最大的城市之一。

en: London is one of the largest cities in the world.
zh: 伦敦是世界上最大的城市之一。

en: London was bombed several times.
zh: 伦敦被炸过好几次。

en: What time is it in London now?
zh: 伦敦现在几点了？

en: It is seven in London now.
zh: 伦敦现在七点。

en: London is different from Tokyo climatically.
zh: 伦敦和东京的气候不太一样。

en: London is the capital of England.
zh: 伦敦是英国的首都。

en: Was it rainy in London?
zh: 伦敦那时候下雨了吗？

en: London is no longer a city of fog.
zh: 伦敦现在已经不再是雾都了。

en: London is large, compared with Paris.
zh: 跟巴黎比起来，伦敦挺大的。

en: London is such a large city that visitors must use buses and the underground railway to get about.
zh: 伦敦太大了，游客出门得坐公交和地铁才行。

en: London is on the Thames.
zh: 伦敦就在泰晤士河边。

en: London, where I live, used to be famous for its fog.
zh: 我住的伦敦，以前以大雾出名。

en: Did you have a good time on your trip to London?
zh: 你伦敦之旅玩得开心吗？

en: In the London underground there is a warning to "mind the gap" when boarding the train.
zh: 伦敦地铁在进站时会有“小心间隙”的提示。

en: Much of London was destroyed in the seventeenth century.
zh: 十七世纪的时候，伦敦的大部分地方都被毁了。

en: The people of London are very proud of this bridge.
zh: 伦敦人为这座桥感到很自豪。

en: The population of London is much greater than that of any other British city.
zh: 伦敦的人口比英国其他任何城市都多得多。

en: Do you know the concert schedule of London Symphony Orchestra?
zh: 你知道伦敦交响乐团的演出时间表吗？

en: In London, the police are always worried about finding a bomb on the train or subway.
zh: 在伦敦，警察总是担心火车或地铁里会有炸弹。

en: London air was not much to boast of at best.
zh: 伦敦的空气充其量也就那样，没什么好夸的。

en: London's climate differs from that of Tokyo.
zh: 伦敦的气候跟东京不同。

en: I'm looking for information on the Anderson Antique Shop in London.
zh: 我在找伦敦安德森古董店的信息。

en: Please call me as soon as possible when you arrive in London.
zh: 你一到伦敦就尽快给我打个电话。

en: On his arrival in London, he sent me a telegram.
zh: 他一到伦敦就给我发了份电报。

en: As soon as I get to London, I'll drop you a line.
zh: 我一到伦敦就给你发个消息。

en: Be sure to drop us a line as soon as you get to London.
zh: 你到了伦敦一定要记得给我们发个消息。

en: During my stay in London, I met him.
zh: 我在伦敦待着的时候见过他。

en: During his stay in London, he is going to visit his cousin.
zh: 他在伦敦期间打算去看看他的表亲。

en: Is it true that you are going to study in London?
zh: 听说你要去伦敦留学，是真的吗？

en: As long as I'm going to be in London, I ought to see a play or two.
zh: 既然要去伦敦，我得去看一两场戏。

en: I have been to London before.
zh: 我以前去过伦敦。

en: There are a lot of parks in London.
zh: 伦敦有很多公园。

en: When did you get to London?
zh: 你是什么时候到伦敦的？

en: I got a letter from a friend of mine in London.
zh: 我收到了一个伦敦朋友的来信。

en: It is Mrs. Lee, Susan's mother, in London.
zh: 在伦敦的那位是苏珊的妈妈李太太。

en: What was your first impression of London?
zh: 你对伦敦的第一印象是什么？

en: The people he is living with in London are coming to see me.
zh: 他在伦敦一起住的人要来看我了。

en: Can you recommend a place to stay in London?
zh: 你能推荐个伦敦住的地方吗？

en: I met an old student of mine in London.
zh: 我在伦敦遇到了以前的一个学生。

en: I had an enjoyable two weeks in London.
zh: 我在伦敦度过了愉快的两周。

en: I sometimes look back on the good days I had in London.
zh: 我偶尔会回想起在伦敦的那段美好时光。

en: I used to go to plays at least once a week in London.
zh: 我以前在伦敦时，每周起码去看一次戏。

en: The weather is fine in London.
zh: 伦敦的天气挺好的。

en: In London, quite a few musicals and plays are presented at the theaters every night.
zh: 在伦敦，剧院每天晚上都有不少音乐剧和话剧演出。

en: I ordered a book from London.
zh: 我从伦敦订了一本书。

en: Mr Long and Mr Smith spoke to each other.
zh: 龙先生和史密斯先生互相聊了聊。

en: I need a lot of cloth to make a long dress.
zh: 我要做件长裙，得用好多布。

en: Long dresses stayed in fashion.
zh: 长裙一直挺流行的。

en: Long skirts are out of fashion now.
zh: 现在不流行长裙了。

en: Long skirts are in fashion.
zh: 现在流行穿长裙。

en: The Longs are having a garage sale tomorrow.
zh: 龙先生一家明天要搞车库拍卖。

en: Don't forget to ask after Mr Long's wife when you see him.
zh: 见到龙先生的时候，别忘了替我问候他太太。

en: Romeo, believing that Juliet was dead, decided to kill himself.
zh: 罗密欧以为朱丽叶死了，就决定自杀。

en: Romeo is the man Juliet loves.
zh: 罗密欧就是朱丽叶爱的那个男人。

en: The robots are sure to contribute to the world.
zh: 机器人肯定能为世界做出贡献。

en: A robot can do more work than a man can.
zh: 机器人能比人干更多的活儿。

en: Robots can withstand dangerous conditions.
zh: 机器人能经受住危险的环境。

en: Prepare yourself for the day when robots are at your side.
zh: 做好准备迎接机器人来到你身边的日子吧。

en: Robson's proposal is tantamount to defending terrorists because they have a cause.
zh: 罗布森的提议等于是为恐怖分子辩护，就因为他们有理由。

en: We have lobsters only on special occasions.
zh: 我们只有在特殊场合才吃龙虾。

en: Lobsters belong to a class of marine animals.
zh: 龙虾属于海洋动物。

en: Robin looks very cute when he's sleeping.
zh: 罗宾睡觉的时候看起来特别可爱。

en: Despite the seriousness of his illness, Mr Robinson is in good spirits.
zh: 尽管病得很重，罗宾逊先生的精神头儿还挺好。

en: I'll meet you in the lobby at three.
zh: 三点钟我在大厅等你。

en: Donkeys are tough animals.
zh: 驴这动物挺皮实的。

en: Here comes our teacher, Robert Brown.
zh: 我们的老师罗伯特·布朗来了。

en: Robert got a small proportion of the profit.
zh: 罗伯特只分到了很少一部分利润。

en: Robert broke off in the middle of his phone call.
zh: 罗伯特话说到一半突然停住了。

en: Robert used to help his father in the store on weekends.
zh: 罗伯特以前周末常在店里帮他爸爸。

en: Robert comes to visit me every now and then.
zh: 罗伯特偶尔会来看我。

en: I hear Robert is sick.
zh: 我听说罗伯特病了。

en: Robert is content with his present position.
zh: 罗伯特对他现在的职位挺满意的。

en: Robert is the fifth wheel on the safety committee.
zh: 罗伯特在安全委员会里是个多余的人。

en: Robert has not yet been late for a meeting.
zh: 罗伯特开会还没迟到过。

en: Robert tends to talk big.
zh: 罗伯特爱说大话。

en: Robert was so busy he had to turn down an invitation to play golf.
zh: 罗伯特太忙了，不得不推掉打高尔夫的邀请。

en: Robert got the better of Jack in the game of chess.
zh: 罗伯特下棋赢了杰克。

en: Robert enjoyed talking with his girlfriend.
zh: 罗伯特挺喜欢跟他女朋友聊天的。

en: Rod lives across the street from John.
zh: 罗德就住在约翰对面。

en: The lodge rents by the day.
zh: 这家旅馆按天出租。

en: Which do you like better, rock music or classical music?
zh: 摇滚乐和古典乐，你更喜欢哪一个？

en: Rock and roll was a creation of the young generation.
zh: 摇滚乐是年轻一代创造出来的。

en: Rock is the music of the young.
zh: 摇滚是年轻人的音乐。

en: Rock appeals to young men and women.
zh: 摇滚乐很吸引年轻人。

en: Do you have any rock CDs?
zh: 你有摇滚CD吗？

en: It is unusual to see rock stars wearing a tie!
zh: 看到摇滚明星打领带可真罕见！

en: On the rocks, please.
zh: 请加冰。

en: The rock concert was called off because the singer fell ill.
zh: 因为歌手病了，摇滚演唱会被取消了。

en: I've done rock climbing and deep-sea diving and slept in an Indonesian jungle.
zh: 我玩过攀岩和深潜，还在印尼的丛林里睡过觉。

en: We'd like a bottle of rosé.
zh: 我们想要一瓶桃红葡萄酒。

en: I thought you were raised in L.A.
zh: 我还以为你是在洛杉矶长大的。

en: I'd like to make a collect call to Los Angeles.
zh: 我想往洛杉矶打个对方付费电话。

en: Roger works from morning till night.
zh: 罗杰从早忙到晚。

en: Roger slipped on the ice and hurt his leg.
zh: 罗杰在冰上滑了一跤，把腿摔伤了。

en: Roger is a party animal.
zh: 罗杰是个派对狂人。

en: Russian is very difficult to learn.
zh: 俄语挺难学的。

en: Russia is facing great financial difficulties.
zh: 俄罗斯现在的财政困难挺大的。

en: Russia had emerged as a second superpower.
zh: 俄罗斯曾经成了第二个超级大国。

en: What's the arrival time in Los Angeles?
zh: 什么时候到洛杉矶？

en: Los Angeles is one of the places that I'd like to visit.
zh: 洛杉矶是我一直想去的地方之一。

en: Have you ever gone to Paris?
zh: 你去过巴黎吗？

en: Los Angeles is the second largest city in the United States.
zh: 洛杉矶是美国第二大城市。

en: The rocket put a communications satellite into orbit.
zh: 火箭把一颗通讯卫星送入了轨道。

en: The rockets were fired from a launching pad.
zh: 火箭是从发射台发射的。

en: The rocket blasted out of the atmosphere.
zh: 火箭冲出了大气层。

en: The rocket landed sufficiently gently to avoid breaking its instruments.
zh: 火箭着陆得挺稳，没弄坏里面的仪器。

en: The rocket went up.
zh: 火箭升空了。

en: The rocket went up smoothly.
zh: 火箭升空过程很顺利。

en: The rocket ought to have reached the moon by now.
zh: 这会儿火箭应该已经到月球了。

en: The rocket is in orbit around the moon.
zh: 火箭正在绕月轨道上。

en: The rocket travels at a tremendous speed.
zh: 火箭飞行的速度非常快。

en: The rocket was launched into space.
zh: 火箭被发射到了太空。

en: The blast-off took place on schedule.
zh: 火箭准时发射了。

en: The rocket was hardly up when it exploded.
zh: 火箭刚一升空就爆炸了。

en: My bonus doesn't come close to covering all the loan payments I have to make.
zh: 我的奖金离还清贷款还差得远呢。

en: How many payments will it take to pay off this loan?
zh: 这笔贷款还得还多少期才能清？

en: Interest on loans is high at present.
zh: 现在的贷款利息挺高的。

en: I see a surge in loan growth.
zh: 我发现贷款量涨得挺猛的。

en: Role-playing video games are time consuming.
zh: 角色扮演类游戏特别费时间。

en: Lori suggested that we should take a ten-minute coffee break.
zh: 洛里建议我们休个十分钟的咖啡假。

en: Ms. Roland, what do you think about this problem?
zh: 罗兰女士，您觉得这个问题怎么样？

en: Lola danced with grace.
zh: 萝拉跳舞的样子非常优雅。

en: Laura may have been sick.
zh: 劳拉之前可能是生病了。

en: Laura is very particular about her clothes.
zh: 劳拉对穿衣服这块儿挺讲究的。

en: The surprise party for Laura is not tonight, but tomorrow night.
zh: 给劳拉准备的惊喜派对不是今晚，是明天晚上。

en: Laura Ingalls grew up on the prairie.
zh: 劳拉·英格斯是在大草原上长大的。

en: Although 475AD is the year that shows the 'decline' of the Roman Empire, it is not the year of its 'fall'.
zh: 虽然公元475年是罗马帝国开始“衰落”的一年，但并不是它“灭亡”的一年。

en: The Romans worshiped their goddess, Juno.
zh: 罗马人崇拜他们的女神朱诺。

en: Romans did not want their empire to decline; but it did.
zh: 罗马人并不想让他们的帝国衰落，但结果还是衰落了。

en: The Romans tried to civilize the ancient Britons.
zh: 罗马人曾试图开化古代不列颠人。

en: The Romans persecuted Christians.
zh: 罗马人曾经迫害过基督徒。

en: Have you ever visited Rome?
zh: 你去过罗马吗？

en: If you have ever visited Rome, you must have seen the Coliseum.
zh: 如果你去过罗马，那你一定见过大斗兽场。

en: Rome is a city worth visiting.
zh: 罗马是个值得一去的城市。

en: Rome is worthy of a visit.
zh: 罗马挺值得去看看的。

en: Rome has a lot of charm for me.
zh: 罗马对我来说非常有魅力。

en: Rome abounds with relics.
zh: 罗马遍地都是古迹。

en: Rome is an old city.
zh: 罗马是一座古老的城市。

en: Rome is famous for its ancient architecture.
zh: 罗马以它的古建筑而闻名。

en: Do in Rome as the Romans do.
zh: 入乡随俗。

en: Rome is in Italy.
zh: 罗马在意大利。

en: The history of Rome is very interesting.
zh: 罗马的历史非常有意思。

en: I'm looking for books on Roman history.
zh: 我在找几本关于罗马历史的书。

en: The Roman football game was like the Greek game.
zh: 古罗马的足球赛跟古希腊的挺像的。

en: Rome has a lot of ancient buildings.
zh: 罗马有很多古建筑。

en: Fasten the rope to the tree.
zh: 把绳子系在树上。

en: Let go of the rope.
zh: 把绳子松开。

en: Don't let go of the rope.
zh: 别松开绳子。

en: I want a knife with which to cut the rope.
zh: 我想要把刀来割这根绳子。

en: I let down the rope.
zh: 我把绳子放了下去。

en: Pull the rope tight.
zh: 把绳子拉紧。

en: Pull your robe together.
zh: 把袍子拢一拢。

en: He cut himself free with his knife.
zh: 他用刀割断绳子脱身了。

en: Take hold of the rope.
zh: 抓稳绳子。

en: Take hold of the rope, and I'll pull you up.
zh: 抓紧绳子，我拉你上来。

en: The rope was a couple of meters too short.
zh: 绳子短了两三米。

en: Hold the rope.
zh: 抓着绳子。

en: Hold on to the rope.
zh: 抓紧绳子。

en: Holding on to the rope firmly, I came safely to land.
zh: 我死死抓着绳子，安全上岸了。

en: A rope was thrown into the water.
zh: 有根绳子被丢进了水里。

en: Stand back from the rope.
zh: 离那根绳子远点。

en: Ropes surround the place.
zh: 这个地方被绳子围住了。

en: May I have a road map, please?
zh: 能给我一张公路地图吗？

en: Would you put out the candles?
zh: 能请你把蜡烛熄了吗？

en: Rose was blowing bubbles.
zh: 罗斯在吹泡泡。

en: Roast beef is usually accompanied by Yorkshire pudding.
zh: 烤牛肉通常会配上约克郡布丁。

en: Roast chicken is one of my favorite dishes.
zh: 烤鸡是我最爱的菜之一。

en: Rosie was allowed to stay up till eleven o'clock.
zh: 罗西被允许待到十一点才睡。

en: Rosa Parks was arrested, and the black community of Montgomery was shocked and angry.
zh: 罗莎·帕克斯被捕了，蒙哥马利的黑人社区既震惊又愤怒。

en: His confusion betrayed his lie.
zh: 他的慌乱拆穿了他的谎言。

en: Put out the candle. The blackout is over.
zh: 把蜡烛吹了吧，停电结束了。

en: The candle has gone out.
zh: 蜡烛灭了。

en: The candle was blown out by the wind.
zh: 蜡烛被风吹灭了。

en: The candles made the room bright.
zh: 蜡烛把房间照得亮堂堂的。

en: The candle went out instead of having been put out.
zh: 蜡烛是自己灭的，不是被人弄灭的。

en: The candle went out of itself.
zh: 蜡烛自己熄灭了。

en: The candle grew shorter and shorter, until at last it went out.
zh: 蜡烛越烧越短，最后灭了。

en: Burning the candle at both ends reduces the candle to wax in a hurry - just like a playboy having a pretty girl on each arm.
zh: 蜡烛两头烧，很快就烧完了——就像花花公子左右各搂着一个美女。

en: The candle flickered a few times and then went out.
zh: 烛火摇晃了几下，然后就灭了。

en: The candle's flame is flickering in the soft breeze.
zh: 烛火在微风中轻轻摇曳。

en: Please light a candle.
zh: 请点支蜡烛。

en: The candle burned out.
zh: 蜡烛烧完了。

en: The candle went out by itself.
zh: 蜡烛自己灭了。

en: A birthday cake with twelve candles on top.
zh: 一个上面插着12根蜡烛的生日蛋糕。

en: The Royal Shakespeare Company is presenting The Merchant of Venice next week.
zh: 皇家莎士比亚剧团下周要演出《威尼斯商人》。

en: The evening performance at the Royal Theater had ended, and the audience had gone home.
zh: 皇家剧院的晚场演出已经结束，观众都回家了。

en: Roy needn't have hurried to the airport to meet his parents.
zh: 罗伊本不必急匆匆赶去机场接他父母。

en: Roy is secretive and Ted is candid.
zh: 罗伊神神秘秘的，泰德则很坦诚。

en: Roy denied having visited her yesterday.
zh: 罗伊否认昨天去看过她。

en: Roy fastened the medal with a pin.
zh: 罗伊用别针把奖章别好了。

en: Roy practiced very hard to get his ski instructor's license.
zh: 罗伊为了考到滑雪教练证练得很拼。

en: Roy looks happy when his girlfriend calls him.
zh: 女朋友给罗伊打电话时，他看起来很幸福。

en: Lois always butts into our conversation.
zh: 洛伊丝老是插嘴我们的谈话。

en: I'd like to rent a car.
zh: 我想租辆车。

en: According to the X-ray, everything is all right.
zh: 从X光片来看，一切正常。

en: I would also like to rent a car.
zh: 我也想租辆车。

en: Where do I return cars?
zh: 我在哪儿还车？

en: How much more does it cost to return the rental car to another location?
zh: 异地还车要多付多少钱？

en: Through the lens the image was inverted.
zh: 透过镜头看，图像是倒着的。

en: Can I buy only the lenses?
zh: 能只买镜片吗？

en: If you add lemon, it will become sour.
zh: 加了柠檬就会变酸。

en: Lemons and limes are acidic fruits.
zh: 柠檬和青柠都是酸性水果。

en: The lemon is a sour fruit.
zh: 柠檬是一种很酸的水果。

en: Lemon is sour.
zh: 柠檬很酸。

en: The lemon has a flavor all of its own.
zh: 柠檬有一种独特的风味。

en: A tea with lemon, please.
zh: 请给我一杯柠檬茶。

en: Be sure to look over your paper again before you hand it in.
zh: 交论文前一定要再检查一遍。

en: I had a very hard time writing the paper.
zh: 写这篇论文费了我好大劲。

en: I handed in my report yesterday.
zh: 我昨天交了报告。

en: Reports are due next Monday.
zh: 报告下周一交。

en: It's essential for the papers to be ready today.
zh: 论文今天必须得准备好。

en: Please hand in your papers by the last day of this month.
zh: 请在月底前交论文。

en: Will your report be finished in time for the meeting?
zh: 开会前你的报告能写完吗？

en: When must I turn in the report?
zh: 报告最晚什么时候交？

en: You should turn in your term papers by the end of April.
zh: 你应该在四月底前交期末论文。

en: I am terribly busy because the report deadline is near.
zh: 报告截止日期快到了，我忙得要命。

en: This part of the report may be left out.
zh: 报告的这一部分可以删掉。

en: The left fielder ran hard and caught the long fly.
zh: 左外野手拼命地跑，接住了那个远距离高飞球。

en: Miss Red taught me Japanese.
zh: 瑞德小姐教过我日语。

en: Red Mulligan has announced that he'll fight Rocky Luciano next month.
zh: 瑞德·马利根宣布下个月要和洛基·卢西亚诺对战。

en: I remember singing scales every day during music lessons.
zh: 我记得音乐课上每天都要练音阶。

en: Rex was a monster of a dog.
zh: 雷克斯是一只巨型犬。

en: Many restaurants and pubs are on Itsutsugi Street.
zh: 五木街上有很多餐厅和酒吧。

en: When does the restaurant open?
zh: 餐厅什么时候开门？

zh: 餐厅里那些脏盘子真让人恶心。

en: There are several customers in the restaurant.

en: Music started playing in the restaurant so there was a real romantic mood.
zh: 餐厅里响起了音乐，气氛变得非常浪漫。

en: A welcome party took place in the restaurant.

en: Smoking in the restaurant was forbidden.
zh: 餐厅内禁止吸烟。

zh: 餐厅收了我25万日元的派对费。

en: The rescue party searched for the missing passengers.

en: The leisure industry is sinking more money into new resorts.

en: Please pay at the register.

en: I lost my receipt. Can I still get a refund?

en: I sold off all my records.
zh: 我把所有的唱片都卖了。

en: The record is finished. Turn it over to the other side.
zh: 唱片放完了，翻到另一面。

en: The record is finished. Turn it over.
zh: 唱片放完了，把它翻过来。

en: What do you think of reggae?

en: Fill it with regular, please.
zh: 请加满普通汽油。

en: Five gallons of regular, please.

en: Leo started to roar when he was two years old.
zh: 里奥两岁的时候就开始吼叫了。

en: Can you take his place, Leo?
zh: 里奥，你能顶替他的位置吗？

en: A button has come off my raincoat.
zh: 我雨衣上掉了一个扣子。

en: The car burned up in the race.
zh: 那辆赛车在比赛中烧毁了。

en: The race was a photo finish.

en: The race went down to the wire.
zh: 比赛一直到最后一刻才决出胜负。

zh: 赛前，选手们必须先热身。

en: I was exhausted after running the race.
zh: 跑完步后，我简直累瘫了。

en: The horse that won the race was owned by Mr Johnson.
zh: 赢了比赛的那匹马是约翰逊先生的。

en: Racing car drivers aren't just in it for the prize money but also for the thrill of racing.
zh: 赛车手们不仅是为了奖金，也是为了追求赛车带来的快感。

en: President Reagan's tax program has not worked.
zh: 里根总统的税收计划没起作用。

en: Reagan became President of the United States in 1981.
zh: 里根是在1981年当上美国总统的。

en: How long is the Rainbow Bridge?
zh: 彩虹桥有多长？

en: The rangers decided to go to the sailor's rescue.
zh: 护林员决定去营救那个水手。

en: Feel for the pockets of your raincoat.
zh: 摸摸你雨衣的口袋。

en: Within the rape crisis movement, Greesite's dissent is significant.
zh: 在反性侵运动中，格里赛特的异议意义重大。

en: It took Rei 20 days to get over her injury.
zh: 丽用了20天才从伤病中恢复。

en: Soon after graduating from trade school, Ray Murphy was taken on as a machinist at the local automobile plant.
zh: 职业学校毕业后没多久，雷·墨菲就被当地的汽车厂聘为机械师了。

en: I would like mine rare.
zh: 我要三分熟的。

en: Ruriko is a high school student.
zh: 瑠璃子是个高中生。

en: Rumi is the first daughter.
zh: 留美是大女儿。

en: The Renaissance established the dignity of man.
zh: 文艺复兴确立了人的尊严。

en: Luciano, the underdog in the match, will be trying to make the champ eat humble pie.
zh: 卢西亚诺在比赛中处于劣势，但他会努力让冠军低头认输。

en: Luciano might have the crowd behind him, but he's still wet behind the ears.
zh: 卢西亚诺虽然有观众支持，但他还是太嫩了。

en: Lucifera Vampirella is cute.
zh: 露西法·梵蓓瑞拉很可爱。

en: Lucy is a student from America.
zh: 露西是个美国留学生。

en: There is nothing for you to do but obey the rules.
zh: 你除了遵守规则没别的办法。

en: Has my roommate been decided?
zh: 我的室友定下来了吗？

en: It's so easy when you know the rules.
zh: 只要懂了规矩，这事儿就很简单。

en: My roommate is too talkative.
zh: 我的室友太爱唠叨了。

en: My roommate's having a party.
zh: 我的室友正在开派对。

en: The room charge is 100 dollars a night.
zh: 房费是每晚100美元。

en: Is room service still available?
zh: 现在还有客房服务吗？

en: Room service. May I help you?
zh: 您好，客房服务，有什么可以帮您的？

en: Lucy made her parents happy.
zh: 露西让她的父母很开心。

en: Lucy is certain to come.
zh: 露西肯定会来的。

en: Lucy cannot use chopsticks.
zh: 露西不会用筷子。

en: Lucy turned on the light switch.
zh: 露西打开了电灯开关。

en: Lucy was brought up by her grandparents.
zh: 露西是爷爷奶奶带大的。

en: Lucy came closer to the boy and laid her hand on his head.
zh: 露西走近那个男孩，把手放在了他的头上。

en: Lucy should be in the kitchen now.
zh: 露西现在应该在厨房里。

en: Lucy was beside herself with excitement.
zh: 露西兴奋得不得了。

en: Lucy would often play the piano after dinner.
zh: 露西晚饭后经常弹钢琴。

en: Has Lucy telephoned yet?
zh: 露西打过电话了吗？

en: Lucy sometimes visits May.
zh: 露西偶尔会去看望梅。

en: Lucy likes playing tennis.
zh: 露西喜欢打网球。

en: Lucy is a pretty little girl.
zh: 露西是个漂亮的小姑娘。

en: Lucy is from America.
zh: 露西来自美国。

en: Lucy's mother told her to take care of her younger sister.
zh: 露西的妈妈让她照顾妹妹。

en: Lucy has as many friends as I do.
zh: 露西的朋友和我的一样多。

en: It was his car that ran over Lucy and her dog.
zh: 是他的车撞了露西和她的狗。

en: It is certain that Lucy will marry the pop singer.
zh: 露西肯定会嫁给那个流行歌手。

en: Lucy came to see me three days ago.
zh: 露西三天前来看过我。

en: It was not until Lucy left me that I realized how much I loved her.
zh: 直到露西离开了我，我才意识到自己有多爱她。

en: The bike ride told on Louie.
zh: 骑车可把路易累坏了。

en: Louie, your friends are coming.
zh: 路易，你朋友们来了。

en: Fix your room, Louie.
zh: 路易，收拾下你屋子。

en: Lindbergh was the first man to fly across the Atlantic.
zh: 林德伯格是第一个飞越大西洋的人。

en: Lynn runs fast.
zh: 琳恩跑得很快。

en: Lindbergh's solo nonstop transatlantic flight was a remarkable accomplishment.
zh: 林德伯格独自不间断飞越大西洋是个了不起的成就。

en: If it hadn't been for Lindbergh's luck and his knowledge of flying, he could never have succeeded in crossing the Atlantic.
zh: 要不是运气好加上懂飞行技术，林德伯格肯定没法成功飞越大西洋。

en: Linda was called back from college by her father's sudden illness.
zh: 琳达因为爸爸突然生病，被从大学叫回来了。

en: Linda came home late at night.
zh: 琳达深夜才回到家。

en: Linda came into the building.
zh: 琳达进了大楼。

en: Linda stood up to sing.
zh: 琳达站起来唱歌。

en: Linda will try to have her own way in everything.
zh: 琳达什么事都想按自己的来。

en: Linda went to the park to listen to the music.
zh: 琳达去公园听音乐了。

en: Linda can dance as well as Meg.
zh: 琳达跳舞跳得和梅格一样好。

en: Linda stuck her tongue out.
zh: 琳达吐了吐舌头。

en: Such was Linda's disappointment that she burst into tears.
zh: 琳达太失望了，忍不住哭了起来。

en: Linda was wildly excited to learn that her aunt Nancy was coming to visit her.
zh: 琳达听说南希阿姨要来看她，兴奋坏了。

en: Linda loves chocolate.
zh: 琳达很爱吃巧克力。

en: Linda is sixteen, but had no trouble passing for twenty.
zh: 琳达十六岁，但看着像二十也没人怀疑。

en: Money burns a hole in Linda's pocket.
zh: 琳达手里存不住钱。

en: Linda's husband was two-timing her.
zh: 琳达的丈夫背着她搞外遇。

en: Linda does not dance much now, but I know she used to a lot.
zh: 琳达现在不怎么跳舞了，但我知道她以前经常跳。

en: How did you like Linda's concert?
zh: 你觉得琳达的音乐会怎么样？

en: Because of Linda's outstanding grades last semester, I have arranged for her to visit Europe.
zh: 因为琳达上学期成绩特别好，我安排了她去欧洲旅游。

en: Who taught you to play the piano?
zh: 谁教你弹钢琴的？

en: Linda Wood was standing at the door.
zh: 琳达·伍德正站在门口。

en: The child who was caught stealing apples bravely faced the music in accepting his punishment.
zh: 那个偷苹果被抓的小孩勇敢地承担了后果，接受了处罚。

en: Take the skin off before you eat the apple.
zh: 吃苹果前先削皮。

en: I am eating an apple.
zh: 我在吃苹果。

en: Would you like another apple?
zh: 你还要再来个苹果吗？

en: She bit into the apple.
zh: 她咬了一口苹果。

en: Apples grow on trees.
zh: 苹果长在树上。

en: I'd like two kilos of apples.
zh: 我想要两公斤苹果。

en: Do you like apples?
zh: 你喜欢吃苹果吗？

en: The apples are not quite ripe.
zh: 这些苹果还没熟透。

en: They sell apples at five dollars each.
zh: 他们的苹果卖五块钱一个。

en: Apples are sold by the dozen.
zh: 苹果是按打卖的。

en: All the apple trees were cut down.
zh: 所有的苹果树都被砍了。

en: The apple tree has a beautiful blossom.
zh: 苹果树开的花真好看。

en: The apple trees grew old and new ones were planted.
zh: 老苹果树枯死了，所以种了些新的。

en: I didn't know apple trees grow from seeds.
zh: 我以前都不知道苹果树是种子长出来的。

en: Half of the apples are rotten.
zh: 有一半苹果都烂了。

en: The apple-blossom was touched by the frost.
zh: 苹果花被霜给冻坏了。

en: There is a pen between the apple and the book.
zh: 苹果和书之间有一支笔。

en: Which do you prefer, apples or bananas?
zh: 苹果和香蕉，你更喜欢哪个？

en: Which do you like best, apples, oranges or grapes?
zh: 苹果、橘子和葡萄，你最喜欢哪个？

en: The apple fell from the tree.
zh: 苹果从树上掉下来了。

en: There are a few apples on the tree, aren't there?
zh: 树上还有几个苹果，是吧？

en: The apples are ripe.
zh: 苹果熟了。

en: Some apples fell down from the tree.
zh: 几颗苹果从树上掉了下来。

en: An apple fell off the tree.
zh: 树上掉下来个苹果。

en: One of the apples fell to the ground.
zh: 其中一个苹果掉地上了。

en: An apple fell to the ground.
zh: 有个苹果掉到了地上。

en: Would you like to exchange links?
zh: 咱们换个友链吧？

en: The life of Lincoln is read by children all over the world.
zh: 全世界的孩子都在读林肯的传记。

en: Lincoln was opposed to slavery.
zh: 林肯反对奴隶制。

en: President Lincoln was what we call a self-made man.
zh: 林肯总统就是我们常说的那种白手起家的人。

en: Lincoln granted liberty to slaves.
zh: 林肯给予了奴隶自由。

en: Lincoln set the slaves free.
zh: 林肯解放了奴隶。

en: Lincoln set out to abolish slavery in the United States.
zh: 林肯致力于在美国废除奴隶制。

en: Lincoln was a great statesman.
zh: 林肯是个伟大的政治家。

en: Lincoln is a great person.
zh: 林肯是个伟大的人。

en: Lincoln is admired because of his leadership.
zh: 林肯因其领导力而受人敬仰。

en: Lincoln is one of the greatest figures in American history.
zh: 林肯是美国历史上最伟大的人物之一。

en: Lincoln died in 1865.
zh: 林肯死于1865年。

en: Lincoln was elected President in 1860.
zh: 林肯在1860年当选为总统。

en: Lincoln's parents remained poor all their lives.
zh: 林肯的父母一辈子都很穷。

en: Lincoln ordered that all the slaves in the country should be set free.
zh: 林肯下令解放全国所有的奴隶。

en: We associate the name of Lincoln with freedom.
zh: 提到林肯，我们就会想到自由。

en: What operas are being performed at the Lincoln Center right now?
zh: 现在林肯中心在演什么歌剧？

en: Can you tell me how to get to Lincoln Center?
zh: 能告诉我去林肯中心怎么走吗？

en: A runner must pass the baton in a relay race.
zh: 接力赛里跑者必须交接接力棒。

en: The other girls are jealous of Lily because she is extremely pretty.
zh: 别的女孩都嫉妒莉莉，因为她长得太漂亮了。

en: In order to relax, I need to listen to soothing music.
zh: 为了放松，我得听点舒缓的音乐。

en: You should take the shuttle bus.
zh: 你该坐班车。

en: Please relax.
zh: 放轻松。

en: What time does the shuttle bus leave for the airport?

en: Where should I wait for the shuttle bus?
zh: 我该在哪儿等班车？

en: Could you tie it with a ribbon?
zh: 能用丝带把它扎起来吗？

en: Where can I find a shuttle bus?
zh: 在哪儿能坐到班车？

en: What's the fare to Liverpool?
zh: 去利物浦的票价是多少？

en: A trip to the Riviera should do you good.
zh: 去里维埃拉旅行一趟应该对你有好处。

en: She lives near the edge of Wripple, so she drives in every day.
zh: 她住在里普尔边上，所以每天开车通勤。

en: A good teacher must be patient with his pupils.
zh: 好老师必须对学生有耐心。

en: Mr Rich acknowledged her favor.
zh: 里奇先生对她的关照表示了感谢。

en: Ritsuko is something of an authority on the subject.
zh: 律子在这个领域算是个权威。

en: Rick was over the moon about passing the exam.
zh: 里克考试通过了，简直乐坏了。

en: Rick and Carol broke up two months ago, but he's still carrying a torch for her.
zh: 里克和卡罗尔两个月前分手了，但他还是对她念念不忘。

en: I haven't seen Rick since he returned from New Zealand.
zh: 自从里克从新西兰回来，我就没见过他。

en: Ricky, this is my friend Suzuki.
zh: 瑞奇，这是我朋友铃木。

en: Richard said his mother was ill, which is a lie.
zh: 理查德说他妈妈病了，这其实是撒谎。

en: Richard is fair, even to people he does not like.
zh: 理查德办事很公道，即便对他不喜欢的人也一样。

en: Richard Roberts is the author of numerous books.
zh: 理查德·罗伯茨写过很多本书。

en: I'd like to make a person-to-person call to Mrs. Richards.
zh: 我想给理查兹夫人打个叫人电话。

en: Recession is a temporary falling off of business activity during a period when such activity is generally increasing.
zh: 经济衰退是指在普遍增长的时期，商业活动出现的暂时性回落。

en: The best approach to Lisbon is by sea.
zh: 去里斯本最好的方式是走海路。

en: The squirrel was busy gathering nuts.
zh: 松鼠正忙着采坚果呢。

en: Squirrels are quick of movement.
zh: 松鼠的动作特别灵敏。

en: A squirrel hid among the branches.
zh: 一只松鼠躲进了树枝里。

en: Squirrels are nimble in climbing trees.
zh: 松鼠爬树特别灵活。

en: Listening practice tends to be monotonous.
zh: 练听力往往挺枯燥的。

en: After getting downsized he started off on a clean slate and started a business working out of a home office.
zh: 他被裁员后，一切从零开始，在家里办起了公司。

en: The list is as follows.
zh: 名单如下。

en: Put down your name on the list and pass it on to the next person.
zh: 在名单上签个名，然后传给下一个人。

en: Her name wasn't on the list.
zh: 名单上没她的名字。

en: I added his name to the list.
zh: 我把他的名字加到名单里了。

en: Strike his name from the list.
zh: 把他的名字从名单上划掉。

en: Don't leave my name out of your list.
zh: 别把我的名字漏掉。

en: Liz has been dead for eight years.
zh: 丽兹已经去世八年了。

en: Lisa told me that she had tried natto.
zh: 丽莎跟我说她吃过纳豆。

en: Lisa speaks not only English but also French.
zh: 丽莎不仅会说英语，还会说法语。

en: Lisa bears a grudge against Stan.
zh: 丽莎对斯坦一直心怀怨恨。

en: Lisa, keep an eye on my suitcase while I buy our train tickets.
zh: 丽莎，我去买火车票，你帮我看着点行李箱。

en: Lisa, this is Mr Murata. He's my boss.
zh: 丽莎，这位是村田先生。他是我的老板。

en: Rika had a good time singing at the party.
zh: 梨香在派对上唱得挺开心的。

en: Mrs. Lee is a great talker.
zh: 李太太这人特别能聊。

en: A more plausible proposal is the one Leech presented in conjunction with Emmet's theory.
zh: 利奇结合埃米特的理论提出的那个方案更靠谱点。

en: The leader gave up the plan in despair.
zh: 那个领导绝望地放弃了计划。

en: The leader should know where to set up the tent.
zh: 领队的应该知道在哪儿搭帐篷。

en: The conflicts among leaders resulted in unhealthy sectionalism.
zh: 领导层之间的冲突导致了不良的派系斗争。

en: The lamp hung from the ceiling.
zh: 灯吊在天花板上。

en: The light of the lamp glimmered in the fog.
zh: 灯光在雾气中闪烁。

en: The lamp was suspended from the branch of a tree.
zh: 灯挂在树枝上。

en: The lamp was swinging back and forth.
zh: 灯在那儿晃来晃去的。

en: The lamp went out, and all was black.
zh: 灯灭了，周围一片漆黑。

en: Do you have a business acquaintance in Randolph., Ltd?
zh: 你在伦道夫有限公司有熟人吗？

en: Where is the laundry?
zh: 洗衣房在哪儿？

en: You can get in touch with me at Hotel Landmark.
zh: 你可以到置地酒店找我。

en: Are there any detergents in the laundry?
zh: 洗衣房里有洗衣粉吗？

en: Two for the lunch buffet, please.
zh: 两位自助午餐，谢谢。

en: I'll bring lunch.
zh: 我会带午饭的。

en: Lander assumes that rioting and gang behavior are a result of poverty and poor economic conditions.
zh: 兰德认为，暴乱和帮派行为是贫困和经济落后造成的。

en: It is worth noting that Lander made the necessary modifications.
zh: 值得注意的是，兰德做了必要的修改。

en: It is not clear whether Lander intended to alter Emmet's style from the beginning.
zh: 目前还不清楚兰德是否从一开始就打算改变埃米特的风格。

en: Lansing is the state capital of Michigan.
zh: 兰辛是密歇根州的首府。

en: Even if you don't like rum, try a glass of this.
zh: 就算你不喜欢朗姆酒，也尝尝这杯。

en: A Cuba Libre is a cocktail with a rum base.
zh: 自由古巴是以朗姆酒为基酒的鸡尾酒。

en: It says on the label to take two tablets.
zh: 标签上说一次吃两片。

en: Few students can read Latin.
zh: 没几个学生能读懂拉丁文。

en: Latin is a highly inflected language.
zh: 拉丁语是一种高度屈折的语言。

en: The parallel with English becomes even more striking when we realize that Latin continued to be used for many hundreds of years more as the world's first "international language."
zh: 当我们意识到拉丁语作为世界上第一门“国际语言”又多沿用了几百年时，它与英语的相似之处就更明显了。

en: If you want to eat at Raffle's, you must reserve weeks ahead.
zh: 要是想在莱佛士吃饭，得提前好几周预订。

en: Rap is crap.
zh: 说唱就是垃圾。

en: It is in early spring that daffodils come into bloom.
zh: 水仙花是在早春开放的。

en: Russell was a brilliant philosopher, but even the simplest practical task was quite beyond him.
zh: 罗素是个天才哲学家，但连最简单的家务活他都干不来。

en: During the rush hours we find it difficult to get a taxi around here.
zh: 早晚高峰的时候，这附近很难打到出租车。

en: There ought to be more buses during the rush hours.
zh: 高峰期应该多增加一些公交班次。

en: I would rather leave early than travel on rush-hour trains.
zh: 我宁愿早点出发，也不想挤高峰期的火车。

en: Going to school during the rush hour is tiring and unpleasant.
zh: 高峰期去上学又累又不舒服。

en: I was caught in the rush hour.
zh: 我赶上高峰期堵车了。

en: A rush-hour traffic jam delayed my arrival by two hours.
zh: 晚高峰堵车，害我晚到了两个小时。

en: I really enjoyed betting in Las Vegas.
zh: 我在拉斯维加斯玩两把挺爽的。

en: It's horrible to get caught in rush hour traffic.
zh: 赶上高峰期堵车真是太糟心了。

en: It's easy to lose track of time when you are in Las Vegas.
zh: 在拉斯维加斯特别容易忘掉时间。

en: Last call!
zh: 最后点单时间到了！

en: Listening to the radio, I heard the telephone ring.
zh: 我正听着收音机呢，突然听见电话响了。

en: While listening to the radio, I fell asleep.
zh: 我听着听着收音机就睡着了。

en: I'm listening to the radio.
zh: 我在听收音机。

en: I had my radio repaired by him.
zh: 我的收音机是他给修好的。

en: Who is the inventor of the radio?
zh: 收音机是谁发明的？

en: Shut off the radio.
zh: 把收音机给关了。

en: Unless you turn the radio off, I will go mad.
zh: 你再不关收音机，我就要疯了。

en: Turn off the radio, please.
zh: 麻烦把收音机关一下。

en: Would you mind turning off the radio?
zh: 你介意把收音机关了吗？

en: Will you please turn down the radio?
zh: 能把收音机音量调小点吗？

en: I took the radio apart to repair it.
zh: 为了修理，我把收音机拆开了。

en: Can I borrow your radio?
zh: 收音机借我用下行吗？

en: Will it bother you if I turn on the radio?
zh: 我开收音机会吵到你吗？

en: Do you mind if I turn on the radio?
zh: 我开收音机你介意吗？

en: Do you mind my turning on the radio?
zh: 我把收音机打开你不介意吧？

en: Turn on the radio.
zh: 把收音机打开。

en: Please turn on the radio.
zh: 请把收音机打开。

en: I found that I could not study well with the radio on.
zh: 我发现开着收音机我根本没法专心学习。

en: I fell asleep while listening to the radio.
zh: 我听着收音机睡着了。

en: The communication of news by TV and radio is very common now.
zh: 现在通过电视和广播发布新闻已经很普遍了。

en: The radio will not work.
zh: 收音机坏了，不响了。

en: Radio is a great invention.
zh: 广播是一项伟大的发明。

en: The radio gave a warning of bad weather.
zh: 收音机里播了恶劣天气预警。

en: The radio was invented by Marconi.
zh: 收音机是马可尼发明的。

en: The radio gave place to television.
zh: 广播逐渐被电视取代了。

en: It is not easy to speak naturally on the radio.
zh: 在电台里说话要表现得自然可不容易。

en: I have to change the batteries in the radio.
zh: 我得给收音机换电池了。

en: The blare of the radio burst upon our ears.
zh: 震耳欲聋的收音机声突然响了起来。

en: Please turn down the radio.
zh: 请把收音机声音关小点。

en: Turn the radio up a little.
zh: 把收音机声音开大点儿。

en: Turn up the radio. I can't hear it.
zh: 把收音机声音开大，我听不见。

en: Turn down the radio.
zh: 把收音机声音调小。

en: Could you turn down the radio?
zh: 能把收音机声关小点吗？

en: The radio is too loud. Can't you turn it down a little?
zh: 收音机太吵了，你就不能开小点声吗？

en: The radio is too loud.
zh: 收音机声音太大了。

en: The radio doesn't work.
zh: 收音机坏了。

en: If you listen to English programs on the radio, you can learn English for nothing.
zh: 听广播里的英语节目可以免费学英语。

en: The radio is disturbed by noises.
zh: 收音机里有杂音干扰。

en: Turn the radio down.
zh: 把收音机关小点儿。

en: According to the radio, it will snow tomorrow.
zh: 广播里说明天要下雪。

en: According to the radio, a storm is imminent in the North.
zh: 广播里说北方马上会有暴风雨。

en: We listened to his lecture on the radio.
zh: 我们在收音机里听了他的讲座。

en: The radio warned us of the coming earthquake and we started gathering our things.
zh: 广播里发出了地震预警，我们就开始收拾东西了。

en: The radio warned us of the possibility of flooding.
zh: 广播里预告说可能会发洪水。

en: There is a short program of local news on the radio.
zh: 收音机里有一个简短的当地新闻节目。

en: Did you hear the news on the radio this morning?
zh: 你听今天早上的广播新闻了吗？

en: The radio is too loud. Turn the volume down.
zh: 收音机太响了，关小点儿声。

en: The radio is a bit loud.
zh: 收音机声音有点大。

en: The radio is out of order.
zh: 收音机坏了。

en: The radio broadcast the news in detail.
zh: 广播里详细播报了这条新闻。

en: It was Marie Curie who discovered radium.
zh: 是居里夫人发现了镭。

en: Hold the racket tight.
zh: 握紧球拍。

en: Can I rent rackets?
zh: 能租球拍吗？

en: Send me a racket and my tennis shoes.
zh: 给我寄个球拍和我的网球鞋。

en: Playing rugby, he got injured.
zh: 他打橄榄球受了伤。

en: Rugby is an outdoor game.
zh: 橄榄球是一项户外运动。

en: Rugby is a sport which is never called off by rain.
zh: 橄榄球是一项雨天也不会取消的运动。

en: My whole body was one big bruise after the rugby game.
zh: 打完橄榄球我全身都是淤青。

en: The rugby ball is shaped something like an egg.
zh: 橄榄球长得有点像个蛋。

en: How many people do you need for a rugby game?
zh: 打橄榄球需要多少人？

en: Rugby, American football, and Australian rules football all come from soccer.
zh: 英式橄榄球、美式橄榄球和澳式橄榄球都源自足球。

en: A camel can store a large amount of water in the hump on its back.
zh: 骆驼的驼峰里可以储存大量的水。

en: It goes without saying that camels are very useful in the Middle East.
zh: 显而易见，骆驼在中东地区非常有用。

en: Camels are often used to travel in the desert.
zh: 在沙漠里，人们经常骑骆驼旅行。

en: A camel is, so to speak, a ship on the desert.
zh: 骆驼可以说是“沙漠之舟”。

en: Our journey by camel was quite an experience.
zh: 我们的骆驼之旅真的是一次难忘的经历。

en: A long train of camels was moving to the west.
zh: 一长队骆驼正往西走。

en: If you go near a camel, you risk being bitten.
zh: 离骆驼太近可能会被咬。

en: A camel is to the desert what a ship is to the sea.
zh: 骆驼之于沙漠，就像船之于海洋。

en: The Rhine is the boundary between France and Germany.
zh: 莱茵河是法国和德国的分界线。

en: The Rhine runs between France and Germany.
zh: 莱茵河流经法国和德国之间。

en: We must wait for a few weeks to see the lilacs.
zh: 我们得等几个星期才能看到丁香花。

en: A rifle shot broke the peace of the early morning.
zh: 一声枪响打破了清晨的宁静。

en: The Wright brothers succeeded in flying an airplane driven by an engine.
zh: 莱特兄弟成功试飞了由发动机驱动的飞机。

en: Do you have any light beer?
zh: 有淡啤酒吗？

en: We would now like to have some sample flashlights.
zh: 我们现在想要几只手电筒样品。

en: Please turn off the light.
zh: 请关灯。

en: Mr Wright speaks Japanese as if it were his mother tongue.
zh: 怀特先生的日语说得跟母语一样流利。

en: Have you got a lighter?
zh: 你有打火机吗？

en: I put my lighter down somewhere and now I can't find it.
zh: 我把打火机随手一放，现在找不到了。

en: Do you have a lighter?
zh: 你有打火机吗？

en: I searched high and low for my lighter but couldn't find it.
zh: 我到处找我的打火机，可就是找不到。

en: Can I have seconds on rice and cabbage?
zh: 米饭和卷心菜能再给我来一份吗？

en: Lisa is so skillful that she can even make screws and similar small objects for herself.
zh: 丽莎手很巧，甚至能自己做螺丝钉之类的小东西。

en: We've got to catch the lion alive.
zh: 我们得活捉那只狮子。

en: Lions are in the cage.
zh: 狮子在笼子里。

en: The lion is called the king of animals.
zh: 狮子被称为“百兽之王”。

en: The lion is often used as a symbol of courage.
zh: 狮子常被用作勇气的象征。

en: The lion is the king of beasts.
zh: 狮子是百兽之王。

en: Lions feed on flesh.
zh: 狮子是吃肉的。

en: The lion is king of beasts.
zh: 狮子是百兽之王。

en: Lions live on other animals.
zh: 狮子靠捕食其他动物为生。

en: The lion ripped the flesh from the dead giraffe.
zh: 狮子从死去的长颈鹿身上撕下肉来。

en: The lions fought with each other to get food.
zh: 狮子们为了抢吃的打了起来。

en: The lion opened its huge mouth and roared.
zh: 狮子张开大嘴吼了一声。
